Description:
Required.
Contains merchant authentication information.

Required.
Merchant’s unique API Login ID.
The merchant API Login ID is provided in the Merchant Interface and must be stored securely. The API Login ID and Transaction Key together provide the merchant authentication required for access to the payment gateway.

Required.
Merchant’s unique Transaction Key.
The merchant Transaction Key is provided in the Merchant Interface and must be stored securely. The API Login ID and Transaction Key together provide the merchant authentication required for access to the payment gateway.

Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
If included in the request, this value is included in the response. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.

Required.
This element is a container for transaction specific information.

Required.
Type of credit card transaction.
If the value submitted does not match a supported value, the transaction is rejected.
Format: String.Use authCaptureTransaction to authorize and automatically capture the transaction, or use authOnlyTransaction to authorize the transaction for capture at a later time.

Description:
Required.
Amount of the transaction.
This is the total amount and must include tax, shipping, tips, and any other charges.
Format:
Decimal, up to 15 digits with a decimal point.Do not use currency symbols.
For example, 8.95.

Description: The following fields enable you to charge a transaction using payment or shipping profiles.

The ID of the customer profile.
If this value is included in the response, the customer will be able to choose saved payment methods in the payment form.
Contains information about the software that generated the transaction.

The unique Solution ID which you generate and associate with your solution through the Partner Interface.
See the Solution ID Implementation Guide for details.

The name is generated by the solution provider and provided to Authorize.net.
See the Solution ID Implementation Guide for details.
Contains information about the order.
Merchant-defined invoice number associated with the order.Worldpay RAFT 610 merchants can view the invoice number in the Worldpay Reporting Portal.
Description of the item purchased.
Contains one or more lineItem elements, up to a maximum of 30 line items.
Contains information about one item.
Item identification.
The human-readable name for the item.
A description of the item.
The quantity of items sold.
Format:
Decimal, up to four decimal places.
For example, 5.4321.

Description: The cost per unit, excluding tax, freight, and duty.
Format:
Decimal, up to four decimal places.
For example, 5.4321.

Description: Indicates whether the item is taxable.
Contains information about applicable taxes.

Amount of tax.
The total transaction amount must include this value.
Format:
Decimal, up to four decimal places.
For example, 5.4321.

Description: Name of tax.
Description of tax.
Contains information about any duty applied.

Amount of duty.
The total transaction amount must include this value.
Format:
Decimal, up to four decimal places.
For example, 5.4321.

Description: Name of duty.
Description of duty.
Items in this element describe shipping charges applied.

Amount of the shipping charges.
The total transaction amount must include this value.
Format:
Decimal, up to four decimal places.
For example, 5.4321.

Description: Name of the shipping charges.
Description of the shipping charges.
Indicates whether or not order is exempt from tax.

The merchant-assigned purchase order number.
If you use purchase order numbers, your solution should generate the purchase order number and send it with your transaction requests. Authorize.net does not generate purchase order numbers.
Format: String, up to 25 characters.Use alphanumeric characters only, without spaces, dashes, or other symbols.

Description: The following fields contain customer information.
Type of customer.

The unique customer ID used to represent the customer associated with the transaction.
If you use customer IDs, your solution should generate the customer ID and send it with your transaction requests. Authorize.net does not generate customer IDs.
Format: String, up to 20 characters.Use alphanumeric characters only, without spaces, dashes, or other symbols.

Description:
Conditional.The customer’s valid email address.
Required only when using a European payment processor.If you enable Email Receipts in the Merchant Interface, and if the email address format is valid, the customer will receive an Authorize.net generated email receipt.
Format:
String, up to 255 characters.
For example, janedoe@example.com.

Description:
This element contains billing address information.
If EVO is your payment processor and you submit any of the following billTo fields, you must submit all of them.firstNamelastNameaddresscitystatezip

Conditional.First name associated with customer’s billing address.
Required only when using a European payment processor.

Conditional.Last name associated with customer’s billing address.
Required only when using a European payment processor.
Company associated with customer’s billing address.

Conditional.Customer’s billing address.
Required if merchant would like to use the Address Verification Service security feature.Required when using GPN Canada or Worldpay Streamline Processing Platform.

Conditional.City of customer’s billing address.
Required only when using a European payment processor.

Conditional.State of customer’s billing address.
Required only when using a European payment processor.
Format: String, up to 40 characters.For US states, use the USPS two-character abbreviation for the state.

Description:
Conditional.The postal code of customer’s billing address.
Required if merchant would like to use the Address Verification Service security feature.Required when using GPN Canada or Worldpay Streamline Processing Platform.
Country of customer’s billing address.
Format: String, up to 60 characters.Use the ISO 3166 alpha-2 code for the country.

Description: Phone number associated with customer’s billing address.
Format:
String, up to 25 characters.
For example, (123) 555-1234.

Description: Fax number associated with customer’s billing address.
Format:
String, up to 25 characters.
For example, (123) 555-1234.

Description:
This element contains shipping information.
If EVO is your payment processor and you submit any of the following shipTo fields, you must submit all of them.firstNamelastNameaddresscitystatezip
First name associated with customer’s shipping address.
Last name associated with customer’s shipping address.
Company associated with customer’s shipping address.
Customer’s shipping address.
City of customer’s shipping address.
State of customer’s shipping address.
Format: String, up to 40 characters.For US states, use the USPS two-character abbreviation for the state.

Description: The postal code of customer’s shipping address.
Country of customer’s shipping address.

Required.
This is an array of settings for the session.
Within this element, you must also submit at least one setting. For more information on these parameters, see the 'Hosted Form Parameter Settings' section in our Accept Hosted developer guide.
Contains settingName and settingValue.

Conditional.One of:hostedPaymentReturnOptionshostedPaymentButtonOptionshostedPaymentStyleOptionshostedPaymentPaymentOptionshostedPaymentSecurityOptionshostedPaymentShippingAddressOptionshostedPaymentBillingAddressOptionshostedPaymentCustomerOptionshostedPaymentOrderOptionshostedPaymentIFrameCommunicatorUrl

Parameters and values for the specific setting.
For more information on possible parameters for settingValue, see the 'Hosted Form Parameter Settings' section in our Accept Hosted developer guide.
